member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty
member.summary: Helper for applying only those properties actually specified in external configuration.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.PropertySetter`1
member.summary: Simulates passing a property-setter to an "out" argument.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.IfNotNull``1(System.String,Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.PropertySetter{``0})
member.summary: This will only set a value (execute the PropertySetter delegate) if the value is non-null. It also converts the provided value to the requested type. This allows configuration to only apply property changes when external configuration has actually provided a value.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.IfNotNullOrEmpty``1(System.String,Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.PropertySetter{``0})
member.summary: This will only set a value (execute the PropertySetter delegate) if the value is non-null and isn't empty or whitespace. This override is used when {T} is a string value that can't be empty. It also converts the provided value to the requested type. This allows configuration to only apply property changes when external configuration has actually provided a value.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.IfProvided``1(System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement,System.String,Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.PropertySetter{``0})
member.summary: Test the underlying property collection's value-origin flag for a non-default string value. Empty strings allowed.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.IfProvidedNotEmpty``1(System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement,System.String,Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SetProperty.PropertySetter{``0})
member.summary: Test the underlying property collection's value-origin flag for a non-default, non-null, non-empty string value.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions
member.summary: Options that pertain to columns

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.Store
member.summary: A list of columns that will be stored in the logs table in the database.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.PrimaryKey
member.summary: The column which acts as the table's primary key. Primary keys must be non-null, the AllowNull property will always be forced to false. This can be a Standard Column or a custom column in the AdditionalColumns collection. This defaults to the Id column for backwards-compatibility reasons, but a primary key is optional. If the Id column is removed while the primary key is set to the Id column, no primary key is created. It is recommended to declare the primary key as a non-clustered index, although this is not done by default for backwards-compatibility reasons. If the primary key is not delcared as non-clustered and a Clustered Columnstore Index is not used, the primary key will be created as a clustered index.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.ClusteredColumnstoreIndex
member.summary: When true for auto-created tables, the table will be created with a Clustered Columnstore Index. In this case, if the Id column is set as the primary key but is not configured as a non-clustered index, it will not default to a clustered index. Prior to SQL Server 2017 you must NOT use any NVARCHAR(MAX) columns, and this restriction includes the Standard Columns (you must change their size).

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.DisableTriggers
member.summary: Indicates if triggers should be disabled when inserting log entries.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.AdditionalColumns
member.summary: Additional log event property columns.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.AdditionalDataColumns
member.summary: Deprecated. Use the collection instead. The sink constructor will migrate this collection to the new collection automatically until this feature is removed.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.ExceptionColumnOptions
member.summary: Options for the Exception column.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.ExceptionColumnOptions.DataType
member.summary: The Exception column defaults to NVarChar and must be of a character-storage data type.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.FinalizeConfigurationForSinkConstructor
member.summary: The logging sink and audit sink constructors call this. Defaults are resolved (like ensuring the primary key is non-null) and obsolete features are migrated to their replacement features so dependencies in the sink itself can be safely removed as early as possible.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.IdColumnOptions
member.summary: Options for the Id column.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.IdColumnOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.IdColumnOptions.DataType
member.summary: The Id column must be either Int (default) or BigInt.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.IdColumnOptions.AllowNull
member.summary: The Id column must never allow null values (it is an auto-incremnting identity value and normally the primary key).

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.IdColumnOptions.AsDataColumn
member.summary: Overrides the SqlColumn base method to also set Id-specific properties.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.IdColumnOptions.BigInt
member.summary: Set the DataType property to BigInt.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LevelColumnOptions
member.summary: Options for the Level column.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LevelColumnOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LevelColumnOptions.DataType
member.summary: The Level column must be either NVarChar (the default) or TinyInt (which stores the underlying Level enum value). The recommended DataLength for NVarChar is 16 characters.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LevelColumnOptions.StoreAsEnum
member.summary: If true will store Level as an enum in a tinyint column as opposed to a string.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LogEventColumnOptions
member.summary: Options for the LogEvent column.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LogEventColumnOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LogEventColumnOptions.DataType
member.summary: The LogEvent column defaults to NVarChar and must be of a character-storage data type.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LogEventColumnOptions.ExcludeAdditionalProperties
member.summary: Exclude properties from the LogEvent column if they are being saved to additional columns. Defaults to false for backwards-compatibility, but true is the recommended setting.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.LogEventColumnOptions.ExcludeStandardColumns
member.summary: Whether to include Standard Columns in the LogEvent column (for backwards compatibility). Defaults to false for backwards-compatibility, but true is the recommended setting.

member.summary: Options for the message column

member.summary: Options for the Properties column.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.PropertiesColumnOptions.DataType
member.summary: The Properties column defaults to NVarChar but may also be defined as any other character-storage type or as the SQL XML data type. The XML data type is not recommended for high-volume logging due to CPU overhead.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.PropertiesColumnOptions.ExcludeAdditionalProperties
member.summary: Exclude properties from the Properties column if they are being saved to additional columns.

member.summary: The name to use for a dictionary element.

member.summary: The name to use for an item element.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.PropertiesColumnOptions.OmitDictionaryContainerElement
member.summary: If true will omit the "dictionary" container element, and will only include child elements.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.PropertiesColumnOptions.OmitSequenceContainerElement
member.summary: If true will omit the "sequence" container element, and will only include child elements.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.PropertiesColumnOptions.OmitStructureContainerElement
member.summary: If true will omit the "structure" container element, and will only include child elements.

member.summary: If true and the property value is empty, then don't include the element.

member.summary: The name to use for a property element.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions.TimeStampColumnOptions.ConvertToUtc
member.summary: If true, the logging source's local time is converted to Coordinated Universal Time. By definition, UTC does not include any timezone or timezone offset information.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.MSSqlServerAuditSink
member.summary: Writes log events as rows in a table of MSSqlServer database using Audit logic, meaning that each row is synchronously committed and any errors that occur are propagated to the caller.

member.summary: Construct a sink posting to the specified database.
member.param: Connection string to access the database.
Name of the table to store the data in.
Name of the schema for the table to store the data in. The default is 'dbo'.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
Create log table with the provided name on destination sql server.
Options that pertain to columns

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn
member.summary: Shared column customization options.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.#ctor(System.String,System.Data.SqlDbType,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor with property initialization.

member.summary: A constructor that initializes the object from a DataColumn object.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.ColumnName
member.summary: The name of the column in the database. Always required.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.DataType
member.summary: The SQL data type to be stored in this column. Always required.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.AllowNull
member.summary: Indicates whether NULLs can be stored in this column. Default is true. Always required.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.DataLength
member.summary: For character-storage DataTypes such as CHAR or VARCHAR, this defines the maximum size. The default -1 represents MAX.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.NonClusteredIndex
member.summary: Determines whether a non-clustered index is created for this column. Compound indexes are not supported for auto-created log tables. This property is only used when auto-creating a log table.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.AsDataColumn
member.summary: Converts a SQL sink SqlColumn object to a System.Data.DataColumn object. The original SqlColumn object is stored in the DataColumn's ExtendedProperties collection. Virtual so that the Id Standard Column can perform additional configuration.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlColumn.SetDataTypeFromConfigString(System.String)
member.summary: Configuration accepts DataType as a simple string ("nvarchar" for example) for ease-of-use. This converts to SqlDbType and stores it into the DataType property.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlDataTypes
member.summary: Helpers for validating and converting SQL data types and the corresponding .NET types used by the DataColumn class.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlDataTypes.NotSupported
member.summary: SqlDbType doesn't have anything like "None" so we indicate an unsupported type by referencing a type we can guarantee the rest of the sink will never recognize.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlDataTypes.SystemTypeMap
member.summary: A collection keyed on the SqlDbType enum with values representing the equivalent DataColumn .NET type.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlDataTypes.DataLengthRequired
member.summary: The SQL column types which require a non-zero DataLength property.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlDataTypes.TryParseIfSupported(System.String,System.Data.SqlDbType@)
member.summary: Like Enum.TryParse for SqlDbType but it also validates against the SqlTypeToSystemType list, returning false if the requested SQL type is not supported by this sink.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlDataTypes.ReverseTypeMap
member.summary: A collection keyed on the DataColumn .NET types with values representing the default SqlDbType enum. This exists for backwards-compatibility reasons since all configuration based on DataColumn has been marked Obsolete and will be removed in a future release.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.SqlDataTypes.ColumnstoreCompatible
member.summary: Clustered Columnstore Indexes only support a subset of the available SQL column types.

member.summary: List of columns that are available to be written to the database, excluding Id and additional columns.

member.summary: The message rendered with the template given the properties associated with the event.

member.summary: The message template describing the event.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.StandardColumn.LogEvent
member.summary: A log event.

member.summary: Converts values into simple scalars, dictionaries and lists so that they can be persisted in MSSqlServer.

member.summary: Regex to trasnform any non-xml char into ?, acoiding any exceptions on inserting the xml properties into the database

member.name: T:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationMSSqlServerExtensions
member.summary: Adds the WriteTo.MSSqlServer() extension method to .

member.name: F:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationMSSqlServerExtensions.AppConfigSectionName
member.summary: The configuration section name for app.config or web.config configuration files.

Adds a sink that writes log events to a table in a MSSqlServer database. Create a database and execute the table creation script found here https://gist.github.com/mivano/10429656 or use the autoCreateSqlTable option.
member.param: The logger configuration.
The connection string to the database where to store the events.
Name of the table to store the events in.
Name of the schema for the table to store the data in. The default is 'dbo'.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
The maximum number of events to post in a single batch.
The time to wait between checking for event batches.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
Create log table with the provided name on destination sql server.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationMSSqlServerExtensions.MSSqlServer(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerAuditSinkConfiguration,System.String,System.String,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,System.IFormatProvider,System.Boolean,Serilog.Sinks.MSSqlServer.ColumnOptions,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a sink that writes log events to a table in a MSSqlServer database. Create a database and execute the table creation script found here https://gist.github.com/mivano/10429656 or use the autoCreateSqlTable option.
member.param: The logger configuration.
The connection string to the database where to store the events.
Name of the table to store the events in.
Name of the schema for the table to store the data in. The default is 'dbo'.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
Create log table with the provided name on destination sql server.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.
